docs.lead_paragraph: Every year about this time, a small but poignant health care transaction occurs in doctors' offices across the country: a few patients give their doctors holiday gifts. The exchange is usually somewhat awkward, a sudden contracture of the usual fixed clinical distance between doctor and patient, a peek at each other's true lives.
docs.abstract: Dr Kent A Sepkowitz describes his relationship with patient who gave him exact same necktie three years in row for holiday gift (M)
docs.snippet: Every year about this time, a small but poignant health care transaction occurs in doctors' offices across the country: a few patients give their doctors holiday gifts.    The exchange is usually somewhat awkward, a sudden contracture of the usual...

docs.lead_paragraph: Opposition to vaccinations against polio by some Islamic leaders in northern Nigeria has led to the spread of the disease to neighboring West African countries, jeopardizing the World Health Organization plan to eradicate it by the end of 2005. Having reduced the worldwide incidence of paralytic polio by 99 percent over the last 15 years, the organization, a United Nations agency, said it was on the verge of eradicating polio when the Nigerian setback occurred this year.

headline.main: Pocket of Opposition to Vaccine Threatens Polio Eradication

docs.abstract: World Health Organization goal to eradicate polio worldwide by end of 2005 has been severly hampered by political and religious opposition in some areas of Nigeria; opponents claim vaccination causes sterility in young women; concerns about return of polio to nations that have been polio free discussed; challenges facing current vaccination program outlined; photos (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: ''The First Year -- H.I.V.: An Essential Guide for the Newly Diagnosed,'' by Brett Grodeck. Marlowe & Company, $15.95. It is hard to be optimistic about an incurable disease, but the author of this supportive resource, a writer who has had H.I.V. for 25 years, manages to do it. ''Now that I'm healthy,'' he writes, ''I'm far more worried about getting in a car accident on the Los Angeles Freeway than I am about getting sick from H.I.V.''
docs.abstract: Brett Grodeck book The First Year-HIV: An Essential Guide for the Newly Diagnosed offers comprehensive look at coping with HIV that includes finding doctors, selecting drug therapies and dealing with disease; photo (M)
